scenarioDescription:
The GJ 96 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 96 is a star with 0.6 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 38.92 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 96 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 96 system


GJ 96 b

GJ 96 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2018-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 96 b is 19.671 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 96 b is 4.670 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 96 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 96, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: GJ 96 - System With 1 Exoplanet
